relatedanime.anime: Non Non Biyori: Okinawa e Iku Koto ni Natta

recommendations.recommendation: The first 2 minutes of the series features a relaxing soundtrack and a nice, simple view of the countryside. In other words, it`s one anime that doesn`t have bells and whistles - it`s characters are cute and easy going - no explosions, violence or what-have-you.

This is a moe anime, kinda like K-ON, but it has more appealing characters, more interesting setting and is overall more entertaining. I don`t usually like moe but this is a really nice show! Strongly recommended!

yup totally recommended this one, just sit, relax and enjoy
Relax time ^^d

I`ve never watched any of these "little girl school life" shows before. Never really appealed to me. I started watching this for some reason, and I`m so glad I did.
It`s one of the most relaxing, charming animes I`ve seen. Something so innocent, gentle, and soothing about every episode. It`s also really funny! Just a great show. The music and animation are great as well.

This is a must if you want to watch something beautifully relaxing that simply makes you smile at it. This is from a man whose favourite genre is anything with a sword included and has watched EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THOSE! It must be the end of the world... Wonderful Anime! You will not regret it.
so relaxing and lot of cuteness
probably the best slice of life anime out there along with K ON!
In this era of internet and wi-fi and smartphones, Can you find entertainment in a place with no wi-fi, no internet, and so little electricity?
A really good and relaxing anime with nice comedy and beautiful art to it ... must-see !!!
To me this was the best anime this season. Light , fun , well animated , always sad when the episode was over. Good for all ages.

anime.description: When http://anidb.net/ch57472 [Ichijou Hotaru] transfers from a school in Tokyo to the tiny little Asahigaoka Branch School in the rural countryside, she should be experiencing major culture shock. After all, there are only three other girls in the school, and none of them are even in the same grade as her. But she quickly finds herself adjusting to spending her time with first grader http://anidb.net/ch57473 [Renge] and the Koshigaya sisters, http://anidb.net/ch57474 [Natsumi] and http://anidb.net/ch57475 [Komari], who are in the seventh and eighth grade. And the Koshigayas` older brother, the only male student, is not so hard to get along with either. Maybe it does not hurt that Hotaru is a little mature for her age, but there is something about the laid back lifestyle that makes her feel right at home and comfortable. Even if it is 20 minutes by bicycle to the only place that sells comics and the video store is ten train stations away. It is a big change from the big city, but there are still plenty of new adventures to look forward to as Hotaru learns that "home" really is where the heart is... Source: Sentai Filmworks [i]Note: The first episode was pre-aired at a special event on 01.09.2013, regular TV broadcast started on 08.10.2013. Chronological episode order of both Seasons: http://anitay.kinja.com/completely-unnecessary-the-chronological-order-of-non-1723283826[/i]

tag.name: bad cooking
tag.description: The character is hopelessly terrible at cooking, and any attempts he or she makes at making even the simplest dishes are spectacular failures.

tag.name: photography
tag.description: Photography is the art or process of producing images by the action of radiant energy and especially light on a sensitive surface (such as film or an optical sensor). Source: Merriam-Webster

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: countryside
tag.description: The anime takes place far from the any densely populated areas like cities, i.e. out in the suburbs, in the countryside with many fields and forests.

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: dodgeball
tag.description: Dodgeball is any of a variety of games in which players try to hit other players on the opposing team with their own balls while avoiding being hit themselves. Don`t try this at home, kids.

tag.name: shoujo ai
tag.description: Shoujo Ai means girls love, and thus explores what happens when two girls (or women) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2695 [Yuri] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphic sex. The male version is http://anidb.net/t2783 [Shounen Ai]. http://anidb.net/t7146 [Cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] is often mistaken as low level Yuri or Shoujo Ai. If there is no Yuri or Shoujo Ai subtext, i.e. if there is no romantic subtext, only tag CGDCT. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

tag.name: performance
tag.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: iyashi-kei
tag.description: A feel good, "no true conflict within story" type of plot, instead about the daily musings and activities of the characters with an overall tranquil mood. Similar to "Slice of Life", but much more relaxed, peaceful and "zen".

tag.name: character driven
tag.description: The main appeal of the show is the way the characters are portrayed and interact, focusing on dialogue, spending time together or getting to know each other. These anime are not "story-less" but story is secondary to character development and the characters themselves and what they experience.

tag.name: winter
tag.description: Coldest season of the year with ice and snow, everything is covered in a blanket of white.

tag.name: dialogue driven
tag.description: A dialogue driven show has its story advanced by dialogue, with action being of much lower priority, and relies heavily on conversations between characters.

tag.name: everybody is nice
tag.description: All characters are nice in their own way; nobody has ill intentions to others. Even if a secondary character appears to be bad at the beginning, they will redeem themselves or become tamed/pacified/neutralized swiftly.

tag.name: detailed landscapes
tag.description: An amazing view of nature, of artificially sculpted landscapes (i.e. gardens), or of a cityscape.

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: summer
tag.description: At least one of the episodes takes place in summer. Think oppressively warm weather, summer vacation, summer school, summer festival, or a visit to the beach.

tag.name: show within a show
tag.description: A fictional TV (or radio, or stage) show that takes place within an actual TV show; or, occasionally, a fictional instalment or incarnation of an actual show. Many comedies have short one-off gags where they parody existing shows. Example: A large part of Martian Successor Nadesico is centred around the fictional popular anime Gekigangar III, which is being watched by several characters of the Nadesico crew.

tag.name: sibling yin yang
tag.description: In real life, siblings hardly ever act the same. Fiction sometimes takes this to an extreme. Enter Sibling Yin Yang, the occurrence of siblings that are nearly polar opposites. If he`s cool and reckless, she`s responsible and thoughtful. If she`s a spiky-haired hooligan, he`s the nerdy wimpy one. If he`s an immature brat, she`s... well, you get the picture.

tag.name: slow-paced
tag.description: The story — including its characters and events — develop slowly. May contain a weak continuity of plot and/or character development. Or may be a story telling device to increase the "sense of foreboding" in an anime with thriller or horror setting.

tag.name: rural town
tag.description: The rural town is one that is either isolated from what is considered "normal" society or it is so far away from the city centre that there are not a lot of buildings. Some rural towns do not have the technology of the city (and some want it that way), while others just seem to be behind the times. Most of these towns have some sort of farming culture or inn culture.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: autumn
tag.description: Autumn, interchangeably known as fall in the US and Canada, is one of the four temperate seasons. Autumn marks the transition from summer into winter, in September (Northern Hemisphere) or March (Southern Hemisphere), when the arrival of night becomes noticeably earlier and the temperature cools considerably. One of its main features is the shedding of leaves from deciduous trees. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: season
tag.description: A season is a division of the year, marked by changes in weather, ecology, and hours of daylight. Seasons result from the yearly orbit of the Earth around the Sun and the tilt of the Earth`s rotational axis relative to the plane of the orbit. In temperate and polar regions, the seasons are marked by changes in the intensity of sunlight that reaches the Earth`s surface, variations of which may cause animals to go into hibernation or to migrate, and plants to be dormant. During May, June, and July, the northern hemisphere is exposed to more direct sunlight because the hemisphere faces the sun. The same is true of the southern hemisphere in November, December, and January. It is the tilt of the Earth that causes the Sun to be higher in the sky during the summer months which increases the solar flux. However, due to seasonal lag, June, July, and August are the hottest months in the northern hemisphere and December, January, and February are the hottest months in the southern hemisphere. In temperate and subpolar regions, four calendar-based seasons (with their adjectives) are generally recognized: spring (vernal), summer (estival), autumn (autumnal), fall and winter (hibernal). Ecologists often use a six-season model for temperate climate regions that includes pre-spring (prevernal) and late summer (serotinal) as distinct seasons along with the traditional four. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: spring
tag.description: During spring, the axis of the Earth is increasing its tilt relative to the Sun, and the length of daylight rapidly increases for the relevant hemisphere. The hemisphere begins to warm significantly causing new plant growth to spring forth, giving the season its name. Snow, if a normal part of winter, begins to melt, and streams swell with runoff. Frosts, if a normal part of winter, become less severe. In climates that have no snow and rare frosts, the air and ground temperatures increase more rapidly. Many flowering plants bloom this time of year, in a long succession sometimes beginning when snow is still on the ground, continuing into early summer. In normally snowless areas spring may begin as early as February (Northern Hemisphere) heralded by the blooming of deciduous magnolias, cherries and quince, or August (Southern Hemisphere) in the same way. Many temperate areas have a dry spring, and wet autumn (fall), which brings about flowering in this season more consistent with the need for water as well as warmth. Subarctic areas may not experience spring at all until May or even June. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: cute girls doing cute things
tag.description:
Cute girls doing cute things with each other (CGDCT): when girls are super friendly with each other and do all sorts of http://anidb.net/t798 [cute/moe] things with each other, but there is no yuri or shoujo ai subtext -- more specifically, there is no romantic subtext.
* CGDCT applies where the main focus is on moe/cute girls and their interactions with each other. Good examples include http://anidb.net/a9722 [Non Non Biyori] (600 weight / 3.0 stars) and http://anidb.net/a9579 [Kin`iro Mosaic] (600 weight / 3.0 stars). * Generally, CGDCT is applicable only if the anime is also tagged predominantly female cast or all female cast. * CGDCT does not apply if girls doing cute things is incidental to a larger motive/theme/meta. For example, in http://anidb.net/a8168 [Nichijou] the focus is comedy, using cute girls; the tag would not apply.
CGDCT is often mistaken as low level yuri or shoujo ai. If there is also actual romantic subtext, use the http://anidb.net/t2695 [yuri (18+)] and http://anidb.net/t2782 [shoujo ai] tags as well. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

character.name: Ichijou Hotaru
character.description: A fifth grader who transferred in from a school in Tokyo. She`s more developed than most fifth graders, to the point where local old ladies show her pictures to try and arrange marriages. She was born on May 28th. Source: ANN

character.name: Miyauchi Renge
character.description: The youngest, a first grader at Asahigaoka Branch School. She has a habit of saying non at the end of her lines. She has a special sense and often says profound things. She was born on December 3rd. Source: ANN

character.name: Koshigaya Natsumi
character.description: A 7th grader. She`s bright and sets the mood in her class. She loves to pull pranks and she`s put a few holes in her walls. She was born on January 24th. Source: ANN

character.name: Koshigaya Komari
character.description: Natsumi`s older sister, an 8th grader. She`s the oldest female student at Asahigaoka Branch School. The fact that she`s not even 140cm tall bugs her. She was born on September 14th. Source: ANN

episode.title: アニメ化決定! プロモーション映像
PV 1
Anime-ka Kettei! Promotion Eizou
episode.summary: Gensaku: @ "Non Non Biyori" (原作:あっと「のんのんびより」) 原作・あっと先生描き下ろし.

episode.title: 夏休みがはじまった
Summer Vacation Started
Natsuyasumi ga Hajimatta
episode.summary: On the day after report cards are handed out and summer vacation finally begins, the middle daughter of the Miyauchi household, Hikage, returns home. She proudly brags about her experiences in the big city... until Hotaru strolls in for a visit. Later, as Renge is walking alongside a stream, she meets a girl around her age holding a camera who introduces herself as Ishikawa Honoka... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 姉ちゃんと家出した
I Ran Away from Home with My Sister
Nee-chan to Iede Shita
episode.summary: Upon arriving at school, Hotaru learns from Natsumi that a class outing is planned for that day. Everyone sets out with high hopes, even though they haven`t been told where exactly they`re going. When they arrive, they find their teacher and Renge already decked out in work hats and rubber overalls... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 駄菓子屋に行った
We Went to the Candy Store
Dagashiya ni Itta
episode.summary: Ichijou Hotaru is enjoying life with her classmates at her new school. In particular, she has come to think of the diminutive Koshigaya Komari, at less than 140cm, as her "cute Senpai." This feeling soon grows into absolute adoration. Then, one day, Komari calls Hotaru and invites her to hang out together... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 転校生が来た
The Transfer Student Came
Tenkousei ga Kita
episode.summary: Ichijou Hotaru has transferred from Tokyo to Asahigaoka Branch School due to her parents` work. But her new school only has five students, including herself! Ichijou Hotaru, the transfer from Tokyo; Koshigaya Natsumi, the moodmaker; Koshigaya Komari, the oldest of the girls; and Miyauchi Renge, the youngest with a unique sense of perception - the story of the lives these girls live in the quiet, sleepy countryside has begun! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 学校でごはんを炊いた
We Cooked Rice at School
Gakkou de Gohan o Taita
episode.summary: All the students of Asahigaoka Branch School set about to prepare a meal using the produce they`ve grown in the school garden. Komari is in charge of making rice with potatoes. While Hotaru watches, Komari struggles to cook like a pro in hopes of showing up Natsumi, who had accused her of being a lousy cook. Then, when the meal is prepared and it`s time to dig in... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: せんべいがカレーになった
My Rice Crackers Turned Into Curry
Senbei ga Curry ni Natta
episode.summary: Summer vacation is over and the second semester has begun at Asahigaoka Branch School. Natsumi bursts in late after oversleeping on the first day, only to find the teacher absent and the other students in their seats looking bored. The students come up with different activities to kill time until the teacher arrives, but Renge`s tastes don`t quite match those of the older students... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おばけになってがんばった
I Became a Ghost and Tried Hard
Obake ni Natte Ganbatta
episode.summary: After being lectured about their studies by their mother, Komari and Natsumi meet up with Renge to pay a visit to Hotaru`s house. Unaware of this, Hotaru has been busy making plushies modeled after her beloved Komari-senpai. Just as she`s pondering where she should put them all, the doorbell rings... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 水着を忘れたふりをした
I Pretended I Forgot My Swimsuit
Mizugi o Wasureta Furi o Shita
episode.summary: Summer is made for swimming in the sea! The students of Asahigaoka Branch School take a trip to the beach together. As Renge and Natsumi play in their swimsuits, Komari neither swims nor changes into her swimsuit, but only gazes out at the ocean. Then Hotaru shows up in a rather bold bikini... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: また春が来た
Spring Came Again
Mata Haru ga Kita
episode.summary: As light filters through the spring foliage and bush warblers sing all around them, the students of Asahigaoka Branch School set off to pick some wild edible plants. Komari teaches Hotaru, who is gathering wild plants for the first time, which types are edible. And as they continue their hunt, Renge once again starts to suspect that they really do live in the country... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かまくらをつくった
We Made a Snow House
Kamakura o Tsukutta
episode.summary: A sudden snowstorm causes the buses to stop running and forces the gang to spend the night at the school. Hotaru is excited as it`s her first time staying overnight at school, but it turns out they only have two futons and one sleeping bag to share among five girls. Then, moments after this discovery, their teacher falls sound asleep in one of the futons... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 初日の出を見た
We Watched the First Sunrise of the Year
Hatsuhi no De o Mita
episode.summary: The school is deserted, and the trees are bare. The second semester has ended, and the students of Asahigaoka Branch School are preparing for the New Year. The Koshigayas are cleaning house, the Ichijous are preparing osechi, and the Miyauchis are making New Year`s soba. Late at night, Kaede joins the Miyauchi sisters to go out and watch the first sunrise of the year... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 文化祭をやってみた
We Tried Having a Cultural Festival
Bunkasai o Yattemita
episode.summary: After Natsumi declares that she wants to try one, Asahigaoka Branch School begins to plan its first cultural festival. As the girls prepare for the festival on very short notice (the coming weekend), they realize they haven`t decided who to invite yet. They decide to start by inviting their friend Konomi, who happens to be visiting as they prepare, as well as Renge`s sister, Hikage, and the candy store owner, Kaede... Source: crunchyroll
